title: Semicolons & Colons Quiz
description: Two of the most misunderstood punctuation marks! Learn when to use semicolons and colons correctly.

questions.question: Which sentence uses a semicolon correctly?
options: I love coffee; it keeps me awake.
I; love coffee it keeps me awake.
I love; coffee it keeps me awake.
I love coffee it; keeps me awake.

questions.question: When should you use a colon?
options: To introduce a list, explanation, or elaboration
To join two unrelated sentences
To separate a subject from a verb
To replace a period at the end of a sentence

questions.question: Which sentence uses a colon correctly?
options: She needed three things: eggs, milk, and bread.
She needed three things; eggs, milk, and bread.
She needed: eggs, milk, and bread.
She: needed eggs, milk, and bread.

questions.question: A semicolon connects two clauses that are ___.
options: Independent but closely related
Unrelated ideas
Dependent clauses
Questions and answers

questions.question: Which is correct? 'I have visited three cities ___ Paris, London, and Rome.'
options: comma (,)
semicolon (;)
colon (:)
dash (â€”)

questions.question: Which sentence uses a semicolon correctly with a conjunctive adverb?
options: It was raining; therefore we, stayed inside.
It was raining therefore; we stayed inside.
It was raining, therefore; we stayed inside.
It was raining; therefore, we stayed inside.

questions.question: When should you use a semicolon in a list?
options: Only in formal writing
Never in a list
When list items themselves contain commas
In every list

questions.question: Which is correct?
options: Dear Mr. Smith:
Dear Mr. Smith;
Both B and C are acceptable
Dear Mr. Smith,

questions.question: Which sentence uses punctuation correctly?
options: He had one goal: to finish the race.
He had one goal; to finish the race.
He had: one goal to finish the race.
He had one goal, to finish the race.

questions.question: Which is the correct use of a semicolon?
options: She likes tea; he likes coffee.
She likes tea; and he likes coffee.
She; likes tea he likes coffee.
She likes; tea he likes coffee.

questions.question: A colon should generally follow ___.
options: A verb
A complete independent clause
A sentence fragment
A preposition

questions.question: Which use of a colon is correct for time?
options: The meeting is at 3.30 p.m.
The meeting is at 3:30 p.m.
The meeting is at 3;30 p.m.
Both B and C are acceptable

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses a semicolon in a complex list?
options: We visited Paris; France, London; England, and Rome; Italy.
We visited Paris France; London England; and Rome Italy.
We visited Paris, France, London, England, and Rome, Italy.
We visited Paris, France; London, England; and Rome, Italy.

questions.question: Can you use a semicolon before 'because'?
options: Yes, always
Only in formal writing
No, because 'because' introduces a dependent clause
Only at the start of a sentence

questions.question: Which is correct? 'Remember what Mom always said ___ "Be kind to others."'
options: comma (,)
period (.)
semicolon (;)
colon (:)
